meanings.definition: Obtain a new mortgage on a property already owned.
meanings.sent1: She is remortgaging her house to get a better deal.
meanings.sent2: John decided to remortgage his home to lower his monthly payments.
meanings.sent3: The family joked that they were remortgaging the house just to buy more furniture.
meanings.sent4: By remortgaging, Sarah felt like she was giving her financial situation a fresh start.
meanings.sent5: Remortgaging can help homeowners manage their finances more effectively.

meanings.definition: The act of replacing an existing mortgage with a new one.
meanings.sent1: After the remortgaging, the family had a lower interest rate.
meanings.sent2: Remortgaging can be a smart financial move in certain situations.
meanings.sent3: The remortgaging process was smoother than they expected.
meanings.sent4: The couple's remortgaging decision saved them money in the long run.
meanings.sent5: The bank explained the benefits of remortgaging to the homeowners.

meanings.definition: The process of securing a new loan using the same property as collateral.
meanings.sent1: The remortgaging of the property required a thorough appraisal.
meanings.sent2: Remortgaging allows homeowners to access additional funds if needed.
meanings.sent3: The couple considered remortgaging to fund their home renovation project.
meanings.sent4: Through remortgaging, they were able to consolidate their debts.
meanings.sent5: The bank explained the steps involved in remortgaging the house.
